Class UiWidgetAdapterGwtTableColumn

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAltText, AttributeReadAttribute, AttributeReadColumnSpan, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHeightInRows, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadImage<UiWidgetImage>, AttributeReadLabel, AttributeReadLengthProperty, AttributeReadMaximumTextLength, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadReorderable, AttributeReadResizable, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadSizeInPixel, AttributeReadSortable, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadUrl, AttributeReadValidationFailure, AttributeWriteAttribute, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteImage<UiWidgetImage>, AttributeWriteLengthProperty, AttributeWriteOnlyAttribute, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteReorderable, AttributeWriteResizable, AttributeWriteSortable, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, UiWidgetAdapter, UiWidgetAdapterTableColumn, HandlerRegistrationCollector, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteTitle<String>, Accessibility

    public class UiWidgetAdapterGwtTableColumn
extends UiWidgetAdapterGwtWidget<TableCellHeaderAtomic>
implements UiWidgetAdapterTableColumn
    This is the implementation of UiWidgetAdapterTableColumn using GWT.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • createToplevelWidget

        protected TableCellHeaderAtomic createToplevelWidget()
        This method creates the underlying widget.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is called from the constructor but implemented in sub-classes. You should NOT access or even modify member variables as they are NOT set at this point (even final members). However, this design is done by intention instead of passing the widget as constructor argument to give more flexibility by overriding and also for potential lazy initialization of the widget.
        Specified by:
        createToplevelWidget in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<TableCellHeaderAtomic>
        Returns:
        a new instance of the underlying widget.

      • getLength

        public Length getLength(LengthProperty property)
        This method gets the Length for the given LengthProperty of this object.
        E.g. the call of getLength(LengthProperty.WIDTH) will return the same result as AttributeReadSize.getWidth(). Unlike AttributeReadSize this method provides access to additional properties such as e.g. LengthProperty.MIN_WIDTH or LengthProperty.MAX_HEIGHT.
        Specified by:
        getLength in interface AttributeReadLengthProperty
        Overrides:
        getLength in class UiWidgetAdapterGwt<TableCellHeaderAtomic>
        Parameters:
        property - is the LengthProperty identifying the actual property to get.
        Returns:
        the requested Length. Will be Length.ZERO if undefined (NOT set).

      • setLength

        public void setLength(LengthProperty property,
                      Length length)
        This method sets the specified length of this object.
        E.g. the call of setLength(LengthProperty.WIDTH, value) will return the same result as setWidth(value).
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

      • getUiWidgetTyped

        protected AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<?,?,?> getUiWidgetTyped()
        This method is a design suggestion for implementations of widget adapters that need typed access to AbstractUiWidgetAdapter.getUiWidget() and want to perform the cast only in a single place. If you would override AbstractUiWidgetAdapter.getUiWidget() to add the cast and do that multiple times across the inheritance hierarchy this would cause multiple/unnecessary casts. Casting is required as we already declare enough generics for widget adapters and also want to keep the code more flexible.
        Overrides:
        getUiWidgetTyped in class AbstractUiWidgetAdapter<TableCellHeaderAtomic>
        Returns:
        the UiWidget potentially specifically typed.
